refnamediv.refpurpose: Driver for the AAG cloud, rain and brightness device.

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: &dhpackage; monitors the sky IR temperature (clouds), the rain detector and the brightness sensor of the AAG CloudWatcher device. This device was designed by Ant√≥nio Alberto Peres Gomes, see http://www.aagware.eu/aag_cloudwatcher.htm.

The cloud sensor has an opening angle of about 70 degrees and hence gives a general idea of the cloud coverage in the field of view. The brightness sensor is used for informational purposes only. The rain detector is a very fast and sensitive device and even a single rain droplet is detected. It is used together with the cloud sensor to decide the state of the weather.

refsect1.title: Sensor operation
refsect1.para: The state changes to good weather if (RAIN > TRIGGOOD) && (TEMP_SKY < THRESHOLD_CLOUDY) || (TEMP_SKY_CORR < THRESHOLD_CLOUDY) after a period of AAG_WEATHER_TIMEOUT or AAG_WEATHER_TIMEOUT_BAD seconds.
The heating algorithm does not follow the model developed by the original author, which can be found here https://azug.minpet.unibas.ch/~wildi/vermes/RainSensorHeaterAlgorithm.pdf.

If RAIN < THRESHOLD_WET then the rain sensor is heated unconditionally and PWM is 100%. If THRESHOLD_WET < RAIN < THRESHOLD_MAX the amount of heat is defined by a linear function which is 100% at THRESHOLD_WET and 0% at THRESHOLD_MAX and above. If the last rain state was above THRESHOLD_DRY and the rain frequency dropped more than THRESHOLD_DROP_WHILE_DRY degrees then it is heated by HEAT * HEAT_FACTOR_DROP_WHILE_DRY. If ambient temberature TEMP_IRS > MAX_OPERATING_TEMPERATURE or TEMP_RAIN > MAX_RAIN_SENSOR_TEMPERATURE the amount of heat is set to 0% as well.

To define sensible thresholds for THRESHOLD_MAX, THRESHOLD_DRY and THRESHOLD_WET put the device into bright sun light and read the parameter RAIN. Set THRESHOLD_DRY about 10 units below the read value, THRESHOLD_MAX to THRESHOLD_DRY + 40 and THRESHOLD_WET to about THRESHOLD_DRY - 60 units. PWM should then show about 10% at THRESHOLD_DRY.
The recommended value for option -g is THRESHOLD_DRY.

The driver has a built in correction model for the measured sky IR temperature. The constants of the model are defined in aag.h. The meaning of the constants are described in the original documentation which can be found here https://azug.minpet.unibas.ch/~wildi/vermes/SkyTemperatureModel.pdf

refsect1.title: PARAMETERS, VALUES
refsect1.para: The following items are displayed with rts2-mon.

listitem.para: Measured temperature of the sky. Temperatures below about -20 deg C indicate a clear sky.
Temperature of the IR sensor. In principle this is the on site ambient temperature. During day time this value can be much higher.
The driver includes a correction of TEMP_SKY. The parameters and their values are defined in aag.h
In the original documentation this parameter is called rain frequency. The value varies between 600. (wet) and 2100. (dry) and is a measure for the water coverage of the rain detector surface.
The amount of heat produced within the rain sensor.
The device internal power supply voltage.
The value of the brightness sensor. A value of about 0.05 indicates bright sun light and above 3000 it is dark.

refsect1.title: SEE ALSO
refsect1.para: See aag.h for further comments and settings of the parameters.
More about the operation and the communication protocol of the device can be found at https://azug.minpet.unibas.ch/wikiobsvermes/index.php/AAG_cloud_sensor.
